III.2.17 and III.2.21. Calvin, for example, said that faith involves “sure conviction” in accord with Hebrews 11:1 (faith is the “substance [hypostasis] of things hoped for, the evidence of things unseen”). But he also says that God gives access to himself through faith, that the believer must take himself to the “bosom of God,” and that the mind cannot rise to the perception and foretaste of divine goodness “without being at the same time wholly inflamed with love of God”
